snippet: Ken Rees of Think Finance says he has learned that the skills of running a start-up operation aren’t the same as those of leading a larger company.
abstract: Adam Bryant Corner Office column features interview with Think Finance president and chief executive Ken Rees discussing his management technique.
lead_paragraph: Ken Rees of Think Finance says he has learned that the skills of running a start-up operation aren’t the same as those of leading a larger company.

headline.print_headline: How to Become A Bus Driver, Not a Bulldozer
headline.seo: Ken Rees of Think Finance, on Leading a Growing Company
headline.main: How to Become a Bus Driver, Not a Bulldozer
